benchmark_details.name: FIHA-v1
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark for fine-grained hallucination evaluation in large vision-language models, utilizing Q&A pairs generated automatically without relying on LLMs or annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate hallucinations in large vision-language models effectively.
audience: Developers in AI and machine learning
tasks: Assess hallucination levels in vision-language models

methods: Dependency modeling using Davidson Scene Graph (DSG)
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model responses to generated Q&A pairs.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the level of hallucinations detected in the models.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated on multiple LVLMs with significant variations in results.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected aligns with privacy standards, minimizing personal data exposure.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open dataset, available for public use.
